TrustedHTML.summary: The TrustedHTML interface of the {{domxref("Trusted Types API", "", "", "nocode")}} represents a string that a developer can insert into an injection sink that will render it as HTML. These objects are created via and therefore have no constructor.

remarks.para: The value of a TrustedHTML object is set when the object is created and cannot be changed by JavaScript as there is no setter exposed.
-Prevent DOM-based cross-site scripting vulnerabilities with Trusted Types

TrustedHTMLToJSON.summary: The toJSON() method of the interface returns a JSON representation of the stored data.
TrustedHTMLToJSON.returns: A string containing a JSON representation of the stored data.

TrustedHTMLToString.summary: The toString() method of the interface returns a string which may safely inserted into an injection sink.
TrustedHTMLToString.returns: A string containing the sanitized HTML.
